title: How to make money online selling my music - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for the a2a. Good to hear that you make music. Although I publish offline albums, I've never tried online options. Yet, I could guide you from my friends’ experiences. Follow these instructions carefully Firstly, produce your own music album. Use your own style and own way of presenting, Never try to imitate othersGet your music licenced/copyrighted according to your country normsWhen you are all set, create your own domain in Apple music iTunes or any other famous platform like Spotify, Gaana, Hungama and so on. You will need to pay an initial amount for each account where you want to sell your music.You can post promo videos in YouTube and other free streaming platforms.Engage your audience by being active in social media and blog postsIt takes a lot of time to perfect yourself in online music industry. Never give up before your first successWishing you all the best… -Vibin Jabakar

You can't sell your music until and unless you become famous. At first, you'll have to make an effort to send your songs to the various music channels on YouTube ex. Proximity, Chill Tracks etc. You can check out their email address in the about section of their YouTube Channel. • Send your track to them and they might charge a small fee for publishing your song on their channel. • Do this 2–3 Times and just when you become famous or your songs become hit, you can start selling your songs to other channels or you can copyright your songs on their channel to earn revenue • Hope this helped, do give me a follow. I'm new to Quora and would love to answer more of your questions :) • Comment your queries below. • Love ~Shivashish
